about-paragraph: I'm a frontend-leaning Applied Informatics student who loves building useful websites, polishing UX, and self-hosting projects.
fun-fact: My home server is named bebop :D

1.title: IT Technician
1.desc: Providing IT support and system administration within the company, including server configuration and resolving technical issues for users.

2.title: Match Day Director
2.desc: Managing the main LED screen and sound system on the stadium, started as a cameraman / instant replay maker.

3.title: Frontend Developer
3.desc: Modifications and improvements to the web map application, team communication, and design of new components for the user interface.

4.title: Copywriter
4.desc: Writing articles and investment analyses, editing texts, working with WordPress.

communication.label: Communication
communication.proof: Match day coordination with AV crew; clear communication running stadium LED + sound under time pressure.

problem-solving.label: Problem-solving
problem-solving.proof: Small automations to cut repetitive tasks and reduce ticket time.

teamwork.label: Teamwork
teamwork.proof: Cross-role collaboration (tech support, AV ops, editors) to keep events and services running.

empathy.label: Empathy
empathy.proof: Support for students/staff with varying tech levels; tailored guidance and calm troubleshooting.

focus.label: Focus & Depth
focus.proof: Built self-hosted tools; long deep-work sessions to ship useful utilities.

adaptability.label: Adaptability
adaptability.proof: Switched between roles as needs changed; learned on the fly.

nm.title: Necromancer's Mystery
nm.desc: Text-based web game with pixel-art graphics, custom SFX, and mini-games. Players navigate a story with multiple endings, a decision tree, and turn-based combat. Includes mini-games, character customization, and a gallery of visited locations.

pokemon.title: Pokémon Sandstone
pokemon.desc: Fan-made monster-catching project created in Unity. I implemented all programming (C#): catching, turn-based battles, inventory, XP/badges, UI, and scene flow. Art & 3D: Pavka5.

wmb-pay.title: WMB Pay
wmb-pay.desc: Simple 'pay me' page with live amount from URL (e.g. /300), QR code generation, and mobile-first UX.
